The ending is simple to understand tbh. The MC magically extended his lifespan and managed to create his ideal world. The high-tech gun shown at the beginning looks like a mauser 1912, so the war should be their equivalent of WW1 which means the MC is at least 100-year-old at the end.

From how the ending is, and man what an ending to a good read, I want to think that it was in the far future. The future they all dreamed of and the characters presented in those final pages are reincarnations that are now living happily in that future where the races/cultures are getting along.

First off, this was some really good shit! Agreed!? All around grade A work and my only gripe is that I wish it had more! P.s. For those of you who loved this like I did, maybe check out Renai Akuma (Love and Devil) by Yanagi Masashi. It's another similarly great read and can be found here on nhentai of course!

Let me clear this up again. When the dark elf resurrected him, he wasn't resurrected as a human he used to be. Instead he was resurrected with dark elf astonishing magic which made him live a very long time. As for the elf, well elf lives a very long time probably (according to cliche titles for elf's age) a 200+ yr is 20 yrs in elf years.

The last couple of ending pages always puzzled me. Obviously, it has to be the future in the setting because all the demi-humans and humans are getting along and technology is more advanced, ect. - but who the fuck is that guy? The MC? His decedents? Part of me wishes it hadn't just stopped there. Think of the demi-human/human sex pair ups and "cultural exchanges," author!
